Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to assess and document risk
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Did the Applicant fail to comply with the Act by not assessing and documenting risks?
Crimes.Governing_Law: Proceeds of Crime (Money Laundering) and Terrorist Financing Act, s 9.6(2); Regulations, s 71(1)(c)
Crimes.Application_Facts: The Applicant did not conduct a formal risk assessment despite being required to do so under the Act. The Director found this omission reasonable given the lack of evidence of any risk assessment.
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: The Applicant committed the violation as no risk assessment was conducted, making the finding reasonable.
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Appeal against FINTRACâ€™s decision imposing penalties
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Appeal partially allowed; case returned to the Director for re-determination of penalties.
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Failure to conduct and document required risk assessment
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Requirement to assess and document risks under applicable legislation
Crimes.Applicable_Legislation: Proceeds of Crime (Money Laundering) and Terrorist Financing Act and associated Regulations
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: FINTRAC examination followed by appeal process
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Not explicitly assessed, but lack of documentation weighed against Applicant
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Lack of documented risk assessment during examination
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: s 9.6(2) of the Act; s 71(1)(c) of the Regulations
Crimes.Application_Basis: Obligation to assess and document risks related to money laundering and terrorist financing
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Absence of formal risk assessment records
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Businesses must assess and document risks under the Act and Regulations
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: No formal risk assessment conducted or documented
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Potential systemic risk due to lack of risk management framework
Crimes.Cause_Description: FINTRAC identified deficiencies in the Applicant's compliance with anti-money laundering laws
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Insufficient documentation provided to demonstrate compliance
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Proceeds of Crime (Money Laundering) and Terrorist Financing Act
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal jurisdiction under Canadian anti-money laundering regime
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Negative inference drawn from absence of documentation
Crimes.Decision_Making_Body: FINTRAC Director, subject to appeal tribunal/court
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to produce required records constitutes non-compliance
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Objective standard of compliance with statutory obligations

Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to develop a written ongoing compliance training program
Crimes.Crime_Type: Human Rights Violations and Serious International Law Offenses
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Involved: s 96.1(1) of the Act; s 7(1)(d) of the Regulations
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Applicant neglected to establish a compliant training program despite regulatory obligations
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Appeal of penalty imposed by FINTRAC
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Proceeds of Crime (Money Laundering) and Terrorist Financing Act and Regulations
Crimes.Evidence_Requirement: Existence of documented, ongoing compliance training program
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Applicant violated the Act by failing to implement a required training program
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence (lack of training policy details)
Crimes.Nature_of_Participation: Obligation to train employees and agents on AML/CTF procedures
Crimes.Legal_Statute: Proceeds of Crime (Money Laundering) and Terrorist Financing Act
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Requirement to have a written ongoing compliance training program
Crimes.Risk_Factor: Increased vulnerability to money laundering due to untrained staff
Crimes.Targeted_Group: Employees and agents of the business
Crimes.Victim_Basis: Public interest in preventing money laundering

Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to develop and apply written compliance policies and procedures
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Did the Applicant fail to comply with the Act's requirements for written compliance policies, risk assessments, and training programs?
Crimes.Governing_Law: Proceeds of Crime (Money Laundering) and Terrorist Financing Act
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Policies were inadequate; updates post-examination not considered
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Violation upheld, but penalty calculation found unreasonable
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On regulator to justify penalty; on applicant to show procedural unfairness
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Not central; focus on documentary compliance
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Businesses must implement compliance policies, conduct risk assessments, and maintain training programs
Crimes.Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness of penalty and procedural fairness
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Lack of transparency in penalty calculation
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Non-compliance with regulatory requirements for money transfer businesses
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Deficiency in transparency of penalty rationale
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Inadequate policies, no documented risk assessment, insufficient training
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Proceeds of Crime (Money Laundering) and Terrorist Financing Act
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Unreasonable penalty amount and lack of transparency
Crimes.Court_Result: Appeal partially allowed; remanded for penalty re-determination
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Updated policies after examination, but not during relevant period
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence of policies and procedures
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Proceeds of Crime (Money Laundering) and Terrorist Financing Act
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: Proceeds of Crime (Money Laundering) and Terrorist Financing Act
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Failure to meet statutory compliance obligations

Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to comply with Proceeds of Crime (Money Laundering) and Terrorist Financing Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Did Kabul Farms Inc. violate the Act by failing to implement compliance policies, perform risk assessments, and develop a training program?
Crimes.Governing_Law: Proceeds of Crime (Money Laundering) and Terrorist Financing Act
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: No adequate policies, no risk assessment, no training program during examination period
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Violations upheld, but penalty re-determination ordered
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On FINTRAC to prove violations; on applicant to challenge penalty reasonableness
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Not at issue; objective non-compliance demonstrated
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Businesses must have written compliance policies, conduct risk assessments, and maintain training programs
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Lack of transparency in penalty calculation
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Absence of policies, risk assessments, and training during relevant period
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Proceeds of Crime (Money Laundering) and Terrorist Financing Act
Crimes.Court_Result: Violations upheld, case remitted for penalty re-determination
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Post-examination improvements not relevant to violation period
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Proceeds of Crime (Money Laundering) and Terrorist Financing Act
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: Proceeds of Crime (Money Laundering) and Terrorist Financing Act
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Systemic failure to meet statutory compliance obligations
Crimes.Applicable_Process: FINTRAC examination, penalty, appeal, judicial review
Crimes.Outcome_of_Review: Partial victory for applicant on procedural grounds
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Mandatory compliance with AML/CTF requirements for fund remitters
